intro: Austroeupatorium rosmarinifolium, commonly known as New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy purple to pink flower heads. The plant has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are often aromatic and used in traditional Māori medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in coastal and inland areas. Austroeupatorium rosmarinifolium plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native ecosystems.
